intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. arvorum, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Pilosella bauhini subsp. arvorum is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in mountainous regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
